column4: Ubuntu installer's giving me problems with the DHCP protocol, should I skip it for now?
yes, you can just skip it  for now. It either isn't finding your network card, or having an issue reaching the dhcp server.
it will be easier to troubleshoot after install. Just don't bother selecting to download updates or the third-party options.
If that is your only means of connection, then yes, that's why. Check the network icon in the upper-left (if it shows up)
